io.elimu.a2d2.helpers

Class PasswordDecryptUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.PasswordDecryptUtil

  • public class PasswordDecryptUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this helper to encrypt or decrypt stored variables in your service DSL or passed as JVM parameters. It uses the underlying encryption mechanisms to decrypt or encrypt a String using the decrypt(String) and encrypt(String) methods respectively

    Here's two examples of how to use these methods:
    String encryptedValue = io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.PasswordDecryptUtil.encrypt("value-to-encrypt");
    String unencryptedValue = io.elimu.a2d2.helpers.PasswordDecryptUtil.decrypt(encryptedValue);

    • Method Detail

      • stringEncryptor

        protected static StringEncryptor stringEncryptor()

      • decrypt

        public static java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String str)
        Decrypts a string
        Parameters:
        str - the encrypted string
        Returns:
        the unencrypted string
        Throws:
        EncryptionOperationNotPossibleException - if the passed value cannot be decrypted with the configured salt. This means str was encrypted using a different salt, and maybe this value is specific of another environment
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the jasypt_encryptor_password Environment variable (the salt) is not present or empty. This means the environment is not properly configured

      • encrypt

        public static java.lang.String encrypt(java.lang.String str)
        Encrypts a string
        Parameters:
        str - the unencrypted string
        Returns:
        the encrypted string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the jasypt_encryptor_password Environment variable (the salt) is not present or empty. This means the environment is not properly configured
